Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with leaves and stems that look healthy and strong when it gets enough water and light.
The student can illustrate a plant with droopy or wilted leaves when it does not have enough water.
The student can show a plant with pale or weak-looking leaves when it does not receive enough light.
The student can depict a plant thriving in sunlight, demonstrating the pattern that plants need light to live and grow.
The student can demonstrate through their drawing that plants without water cannot live or grow well.
